intro: Hedyosmos microcephalus, commonly known as the small-headed hedyosmos, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the legume family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
